page.title: 01TRANSPORT
page.content: The main {A28 }road, crossing from {NE to {W},passes {S }towards {Tenterden after merging with the busy {A262}.{40 {m.p.h. }restrictions operate in built-up sections, reducing to {30m.p.h. }on side-roads.Away from the roads, much of the area is either open farmland or wooded. Travellers are guided by the prominent wooden spire of {14th century St. Mary's }and {19th {century St. Michael's. Twentieth-century development blurs the boundaries of {Tenterden }and {St.Michael's},while {High Halden retains a more distinct identity,its 'phone numbers being found in the {Canterbury Directory,}whilst {St.Michael's},along with dominant neighbour {Tenterden,}looks to {Tunbridge Wells}.Educationally, both village schools lie within the jurisdiction of {Ashford .
